body_html:
There is no easy solution to this but it is feasible. There would be several manual steps:

  1. Build a new Inception model.
  2. Load all of the Tensor's except for the last layer with the Saver
  3. For the final classification layer, selectively load Tensor's for the classes you wish to preserve or use in your new model making sure to associate each Tensor with the desired class index. For the other classes, allow the model to use randomly initialized weights.
  4. Retrain the model probably starting from a lower learning rate.
body_text:
There is no easy solution to this but it is feasible. There would be several manual steps:

Build a new Inception model.
Load all of the Tensor's except for the last layer with the Saver
For the final classification layer, selectively load Tensor's for the classes you wish to preserve or use in your new model making sure to associate each Tensor with the desired class index. For the other classes, allow the model to use randomly initialized weights.
Retrain the model probably starting from a lower learning rate.
body:
There is no easy solution to this but it is feasible. There would be several manual steps:
1. Build a new Inception model.
2. Load all of the Tensor's except for the last layer with the `Saver`
3. For the final classification layer, selectively load Tensor's for the classes you wish to preserve or use in your new model making sure to associate each Tensor with the desired class index. For the other classes, allow the model to use randomly initialized weights.
4. Retrain the model probably starting from a lower learning rate.
